channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: CISA Mandates Patching for Four Actively Exploited Flaws in Zimbra, Vite, and More
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added four vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, confirming they are under active attack. The flaws affect a diverse range of products, including Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (CVE-2025-68645), ...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: North Korean Hackers Lure Developers with Fake Job Interviews, Backdoor macOS via VS Code
item.description:
State-sponsored threat actors from North Korea, including the Lazarus Group, are targeting software developers in a sophisticated campaign dubbed 'Contagious Interview.' According to Jamf Threat Labs, the attackers use fake job offers to entice developers, particularly in the crypto and fintech sect...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

item.title: PcComponentes Denies Data Breach, Blames Credential Stuffing for Account Takeovers
item.description:
Spanish electronics retailer PcComponentes has denied claims of a massive data breach affecting 16 million customers, stating its internal systems were not compromised. The announcement came after a threat actor, 'daghetiaw,' attempted to sell a large customer database on a hacking forum. The compan...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cyberattack

item.title: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV
item.description:
A new ransomware strain named Osiris is demonstrating a high level of sophistication by combining tactics from established ransomware groups like Medusa and Inc. The attackers use Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage and deploy a version of Mimikatz named `kaz.exe`, both TTPs linked ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

item.title: INC Ransomware OPSEC Fail: Reused Infrastructure Leads to Data Recovery for 12 U.S. Victims
item.description:
A significant operational security (OPSEC) failure by the INC ransomware group has allowed cybersecurity firm Cyber Centaurs to recover stolen data for twelve U.S. organizations. The discovery was made after analyzing an attack involving the RainINC ransomware variant. Researchers found artifacts fr...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Incident Response, Threat Actor

item.title: Anubis RaaS Ups the Ante with Destructive 'Wipe Mode' to Maximize Extortion
item.description:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named Anubis is gaining attention for its destructive capabilities. Evolving from a prototype called 'Sphinx,' Anubis offers its affiliates a dual-execution model. In addition to standard encryption, the malware can be run with a `/WIPEMODE` parameter t...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

item.title: Cisco Scrambles to Patch Actively Exploited RCE Zero-Day in Comms Products
item.description:
Cisco has issued an urgent warning and emergency patches for a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2026-20045, affecting a wide range of its Unified Communications and Webex Calling products. This zero-day flaw is being actively exploited in the wild, allowing unauthenticated att...

Severity: Critical

item.title: Everest Ransomware Leaks Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers After Failed Talks
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a massive data breach against athletic apparel giant Under Armour. After negotiations allegedly failed, the group announced on its dark web leak site that it has published the full dataset, which it claims contains 191 million records, including 72.7 million ...

item.title: Exposed Security Training Apps Like OWASP Juice Shop Create Backdoors into Corporate Clouds
item.description:
A new report reveals a dangerous trend where intentionally vulnerable security training applications, such as OWASP Juice Shop and DVWA, are being deployed on live, production cloud infrastructure and left exposed to the internet. Threat actors are actively scanning for and exploiting these misconfi...

item.title: 'Skeleton Key' Attacks Bypass Defenses by Weaponizing Legitimate RMM Tools
item.description:
A sophisticated attack campaign dubbed "Skeleton Key" is bypassing traditional, malware-focused security defenses by weaponizing legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software. A report from KnowBe4 Threat Labs details how attackers first compromise user credentials and then abuse truste...

item.title: Zoom & GitLab Race to Patch Critical Flaws, Including a 9.9 CVSS RCE Bug
item.description:
Both Zoom and GitLab have released critical security updates to address several high-severity vulnerabilities. The most severe flaw, CVE-2026-22844, is a remote code execution vulnerability in Zoom Node Multimedia Routers (MMRs) with a near-perfect CVSS score of 9.9. This flaw could allow an unauthe...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

item.title: Spotlight on Supply Chain Risk: Reports Warn of Escalating SaaS-to-SaaS Attacks
item.description:
The digital supply chain has become a primary focus of cyber risk, as highlighted by multiple events on January 22, 2026. A new report from security firm Black Kite warns that the retail and wholesale sectors are highly exposed to attacks that exploit interconnected IT systems and shared vendors. Co...

item.title: osTicket Flaw Lets Attackers Read Server Files via Malicious PDF Export
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, CVE-2026-22200, has been disclosed in osTicket, a popular open-source helpdesk system. The flaw allows an unauthenticated, anonymous attacker to read arbitrary files from the server by injecting a malicious PHP filter chain into a support ticket. When a privileged user...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: Critical Flaw in Popular Node.js Library 'binary-parser' Allows Code Execution
item.description:
The CERT Coordination Center (CERT/CC) has issued a warning about a critical vulnerability, CVE-2026-1245, in the popular 'binary-parser' npm library for Node.js. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 6.5, allows for arbitrary JavaScript execution. The vulnerability exists because the library dynamica...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Supply Chain Attack, Patch Management

item.title: New Android Malware Uses AI to Mimic Human Behavior and Evade Detection
item.description:
A new and sophisticated family of Android malware is leveraging artificial intelligence to commit ad fraud while evading detection. The malware uses TensorFlow, Google's open-source machine learning framework, to mimic human-like behavior, such as realistic clicks and swipes on hidden advertisements...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security

item.title: Critical GNU Inetutils Flaw Allows Root Access via Telnet Authentication Bypass
item.description:
A critical authentication bypass vulnerability, CVE-2026-24061, has been disclosed in the telnet daemon (telnetd) of GNU Inetutils, a common package of networking utilities for many Unix-like operating systems. The flaw allows a remote attacker to bypass authentication and gain root access to the sy...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: EU Moves to Ban High-Risk Tech Suppliers from 18 Critical Sectors
item.description:
On January 20, 2026, the European Commission introduced a revised EU Cybersecurity Act (CSA 2) aimed at bolstering the bloc's supply chain security. The proposal establishes a framework to identify and exclude high-risk technology suppliers from 18 critical sectors, including energy and telecommunic...

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

item.description:
Oracle has released its January 2026 Critical Patch Update (CPU), a massive security release containing 337 fixes for vulnerabilities across its product portfolio. item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a major cyberattack against McDonald's India, alleging the theft of 861 gigabytes of sensitive data. item.title: Drones Emerge as Urgent Cyber Threat to Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A report published on January 21, 2026, by the University of Canberra and Cisco warns of the urgent and escalating cyber threat posed by drones to critical infrastructure. The study highlights that as drone technology becomes more advanced, accessible, and affordable, its potential for use in cyber ...

item.title: NYDFS Enforces Stricter Cybersecurity Rules for Financial Firms
item.description:
The New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) has now fully implemented the final amendments to its landmark Part 500 Cybersecurity Regulation. These changes impose significantly more prescriptive and stringent requirements on regulated financial and insurance entities. As of May 2025, firms...

item.title: Ingram Micro Breach Exposes Data of 42,000 After Safepay Ransomware Attack
item.description:
Global IT distributor Ingram Micro has officially notified 42,521 individuals that their personal and sensitive information, including Social Security numbers, was stolen during a ransomware attack in July 2025. The incident, attributed to the Safepay ransomware group, compromised employment and job...

item.title: CEOs Optimistic, CISOs Wary: Survey Reveals Deep Divide on AI's Cybersecurity Impact
item.description:
A new survey by specialty insurer AXIS Capital, released on January 20, 2026, reveals a significant perception gap between CEOs and CISOs regarding the role of artificial intelligence in cybersecurity. While CEOs are largely optimistic about AI's productivity and security benefits, CISOs are more ac...

item.description:

The advanced persistent threat (APT) actor is weaponizing Google advertising URLs to make malicious links appear legitimate, thereby bypassing security filters and t...

item.title: Stealthy 'PDFSIDER' Backdoor Uses DLL Side-Loading to Bypass EDR and AV
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Fake Ad Blocker Crashes Chrome, Tricks Users into Installing 'ModeloRAT' Malware
item.description:
